recipes.name: Guacamole
recipes.description: A classic, creamy guacamole perfect for dipping keto-friendly chips or vegetables.
ingredients: 1-2 jalapeños, minced (seeds removed for less heat)
instructions: Cut avocados in half, remove pits, and scoop flesh into a bowl.
Mash avocado with a fork to desired consistency.
Add onion, jalapeño, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and cumin (if using).
Stir gently to combine.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate.
recipes.notes: Recipe 001 - Guacamole - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Cheese Crisps
recipes.description: Simple and delicious one-ingredient cheese crisps, perfect for a crunchy snack.
ingredients: 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (or your favorite hard cheese)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place small mounds (about 1 tablespoon each) of shredded cheese onto the baking sheet, a few inches apart.
Bake for 5-7 minutes, or until golden and crispy.
Let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes to firm up before removing.
recipes.notes: Recipe 002 - Cheese Crisps - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Deviled Eggs
recipes.description: Classic deviled eggs, a perfect keto appetizer or snack, rich in protein and fats.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Halve the hard-boiled eggs lengthwise. Gently remove the yolks and place them in a small bowl.
Mash the yolks with a fork until smooth.
Add mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar (if using), salt, and pepper to the mashed yolks. Mix well until creamy.
Carefully spoon or pipe the yolk mixture back into the egg white halves.
Garnish with a sprinkle of paprika.
Chill for at least 15 minutes before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 003 - Deviled Eggs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Fat Bombs (Chocolate Peanut Butter)
recipes.description: Delicious and energy-boosting chocolate peanut butter fat bombs to satisfy cravings.
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., powdered erythritol), to taste
instructions: Line a mini muffin tin with paper liners or use silicone molds.
In a medium bowl, combine melted coconut oil, melted butter, peanut butter, sweetener, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, and salt. Stir until smooth.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Pour the mixture evenly into the prepared muffin cups or molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 004 - Fat Bombs (Chocolate Peanut Butter) - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs with Avocado
recipes.description: A quick and satisfying keto breakfast with creamy avocado.
ingredients: Optional: 1 tablespoon heavy cream (for fluffier eggs)
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl, add heavy cream (if using), salt, and pepper. Whisk well.
Melt butter or oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour in the egg mixture. Let it sit for about 20-30 seconds until the edges begin to set.
Gently push the eggs from the edges toward the center, tilting the pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Continue cooking until eggs are cooked to your liking.
Serve immediately with sliced or diced avocado on top.
recipes.notes: Recipe 005 - Scrambled Eggs with Avocado - Breakfast

recipes.name: Almond Flour Pancakes
recipes.description: Fluffy and delicious low-carb pancakes made with almond flour.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons erythritol or your preferred keto sweetener
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together almond flour, sweetener, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, almond milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or non-stick pan over medium-low heat.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve warm with keto-friendly syrup and berries (in moderation).
recipes.notes: Recipe 006 - Almond Flour Pancakes - Breakfast

recipes.name: Chia Seed Pudding
recipes.description: A simple, make-ahead keto breakfast or dessert, packed with fiber and healthy fats.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk (full-fat recommended for creaminess)
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol, monk fruit), to taste
Optional toppings: berries, shredded coconut, chopped nuts
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine chia seeds, almond/coconut milk, sweetener, and vanilla extract.
Whisk or stir very well to combine, ensuring no clumps of chia seeds remain.
Let it sit for 5-10 minutes, then stir again to break up any gelling.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours, or preferably overnight, until thick and pudding-like.
Stir before serving. Add toppings if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 007 - Chia Seed Pudding - Breakfast

recipes.name: Sausage and Egg Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Portable and delicious keto breakfast muffins, perfect for meal prep.
ingredients: 1 lb ground sausage (pork, turkey, or beef - check for no added sugar)
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese (or your favorite cheese)
1/4 cup chopped bell peppers (any color, optional)
1/4 cup chopped onions or green onions (optional)
Cooking spray or butter for muffin tin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.
In a skillet, cook the ground sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon. Drain any excess grease.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in the cooked sausage, shredded cheese, bell peppers (if using), and onions (if using) into the whisked eggs.
Divide the mixture evenly among the prepared muffin cups.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the muffins are set and lightly golden on top.
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before removing. Serve warm or store in the refrigerator for later.
recipes.notes: Recipe 008 - Sausage and Egg Breakfast Muffins - Breakfast

recipes.name: Broccoli Cheddar Soup
recipes.description: A creamy and comforting broccoli cheddar soup that's fully keto-compliant.
ingredients: 2 cups chicken broth or vegetable broth
instructions: Melt butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add broccoli florets and broth. Bring to a simmer, then cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until broccoli is tender.

Carefully transfer the soup to a blender (or use an immersion blender) and blend until smooth. If using a standard blender, you may need to do this in batches and vent the lid to allow steam to escape.
Return the soup to the pot. Stir in heavy cream and shredded cheddar cheese.
Cook over low heat, stirring continuously, until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through. Do not boil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
recipes.notes: Recipe 009 - Broccoli Cheddar Soup - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Caesar Salad
recipes.description: A classic Caesar salad made keto with a creamy, homemade dressing and optional grilled chicken.
ingredients: 1 large head of romaine lettuce, chopped
Optional: Keto croutons (made from keto bread or cheese crisps)
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce (check for low sugar content)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together all dressing ingredients (mayonnaise, olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, minced garlic, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper). Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached.
In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce and grated Parmesan cheese.
If using, add cooked chicken and keto croutons.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat evenly.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 010 - Caesar Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Egg Drop Soup
recipes.description: A quick, simple, and comforting keto-friendly version of the classic egg drop soup.
ingredients: 4 cups chicken broth or bone broth
1 tablespoon soy sauce or coconut aminos
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine chicken broth, soy sauce (or coconut aminos), grated ginger, and sesame oil.
Bring the broth to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
Once simmering, slowly drizzle the lightly beaten eggs into the hot broth while gently stirring the broth in a circular motion with a fork or chopsticks. This creates the egg ribbons.
Cook for about 1 minute more, until the egg ribbons are set.
Season with white pepper if desired.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with sliced green onions. Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 011 - Egg Drop Soup - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Cobb Salad
recipes.description: A hearty and satisfying keto Cobb salad loaded with flavor and healthy fats.
ingredients: 4 slices bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled
1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved (optional, use sparingly)
1/4 cup sour cream or full-fat Greek yogurt
instructions: Prepare the Keto Ranch Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, almond milk (start with 1 tbsp), parsley, dill, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Add more almond milk if needed to reach desired consistency. Set aside.
On a large plate or in a large bowl, arrange the chopped romaine lettuce as a base.
Neatly arrange the cooked chicken, crumbled bacon, chopped hard-boiled eggs, diced avocado, cherry tomatoes (if using), and crumbled blue cheese in rows or sections over the lettuce.
Drizzle with the Keto Ranch Dressing just before serving, or serve the dressing on the side.
recipes.notes: Recipe 012 - Cobb Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Steak Bites
recipes.description: Tender and juicy steak bites cooked in a rich garlic butter sauce.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs sirloin steak, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 teaspoon dried Italian herbs (or fresh parsley, chopped)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Pat the steak cubes dry with paper towels and season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add steak cubes in a single layer (cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding) and sear for 1-2 minutes per side, until browned.
Remove steak from skillet and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium. Add butter to the same skillet. Once melted, add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant (be careful not to burn it).
Return the steak bites to the skillet. Add Italian herbs (or parsley). Toss to coat the steak with the garlic butter sauce.
Cook for another 1-2 minutes, or until steak is cooked to your desired doneness.
Serve hot, garnished with more fresh parsley if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 013 - Garlic Butter Steak Bites - Main Course

recipes.name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
recipes.description: A flavorful and juicy whole roasted chicken with lemon and herbs.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil or melted butter
1 lemon, halved (one half sliced, other half for juicing)
1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped (or 1 teaspoon dried)
1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped (or 1 teaspoon dried)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Onion and celery chunks for stuffing cavity
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. This helps the skin get crispy.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil (or melted butter), juice from half a lemon, minced garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan or large oven-safe skillet. If using, stuff the cavity with the sliced lemon half, and optionally onion and celery chunks.
Rub the herb mixture all over the chicken, including under the skin of the breast if possible.
Roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes to 1 hour and 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thigh.
Baste the chicken with pan juices a couple of times during roasting if desired.
Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving. This helps keep it juicy.
Serve with pan juices.
recipes.notes: Recipe 014 - Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken - Main Course

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
recipes.description: A simple and healthy one-pan meal with flaky salmon and tender asparagus.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Toss asparagus with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, and pepper directly on the baking sheet. Spread in a single layer.
Pat salmon fillets dry. Place them on the same baking sheet next to the asparagus.
In a small bowl, mix the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Brush or pour the mixture over the salmon fillets. Top each fillet with a lemon slice.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, and asparagus is tender-crisp.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 015 - Baked Salmon with Asparagus - Main Course

recipes.name: Creamy Tuscan Shrimp
recipes.description: Juicy shrimp in a rich and creamy Tuscan-style sauce with sun-dried tomatoes and spinach.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes (oil-packed, drained and chopped)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes per side, until pink and cooked through. Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
Reduce heat to low and stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Cook, stirring, until sauce thickens slightly.
Stir in fresh spinach until it wilts.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce. Heat through for about 1 minute.
Season with additional salt and pepper if needed. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately. Great with zucchini noodles or cauliflower rice.
recipes.notes: Recipe 016 - Creamy Tuscan Shrimp - Main Course

recipes.name: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
recipes.description: A rich and creamy chocolate mousse made with healthy avocados – you won't taste them!
ingredients: 1/4 cup keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol or monk fruit), or to taste
1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk (or coconut milk)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender.
Blend until completely smooth and creamy. You may need to stop and scrape down the sides a few times.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Divide into small serving dishes and chill for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow it to thicken.
Optional: Garnish with keto-friendly whipped cream or berries.
recipes.notes: Recipe 017 - Chocolate Avocado Mousse - Desserts

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Simple 3-ingredient keto peanut butter cookies that are soft and delicious.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened peanut butter (check labels for no added sugar)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, combine peanut butter, sweetener, and egg. Mix well until a dough forms.
Roll the dough into small balls (about 1 inch each) and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Use a fork to press down on each ball in a crisscross pattern.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden. The cookies will be soft but will firm up as they cool.
Let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
recipes.notes: Recipe 018 - Peanut Butter Cookies - Desserts

recipes.name: Cheesecake Fluff
recipes.description: A light, creamy, and no-bake keto cheesecake fluff that's quick to make.
ingredients: 1/4 cup keto-friendly powdered sweetener (e.g., erythritol), or to taste
Optional: 1 tablespoon lemon juice for a tangier flavor
Optional toppings: Fresh berries, sugar-free chocolate shavings, chopped nuts
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat the softened cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth and fluffy.
Add the powdered sweetener, vanilla extract, and lemon juice (if using). Beat again until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture until fully incorporated and no streaks remain.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Spoon into individual serving dishes. Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving, or serve immediately.
Garnish with desired toppings before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 019 - Cheesecake Fluff - Desserts

recipes.name: Lemon Mug Cake
recipes.description: A quick and zesty single-serving keto lemon mug cake for when cravings strike.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon melted butter or coconut oil
1/2 teaspoon lemon zest (optional, for extra flavor)
instructions: In a microwave-safe mug, whisk together almond flour, coconut flour, sweetener, baking powder, and salt.
Add the egg, melted butter/oil, lemon juice, and lemon zest (if using). Stir well until a smooth batter forms.
Microwave on high for 60-90 seconds, or until the cake is cooked through and springs back when touched. Cooking time may vary depending on microwave wattage.
Let cool for a minute or two before eating. Be careful, the mug will be hot.
Optional: Top with a keto-friendly glaze (powdered sweetener mixed with a little lemon juice) or whipped cream.
recipes.notes: Recipe 020 - Lemon Mug Cake - Desserts

recipes.name: Coffee (Bulletproof Style)
recipes.description: A rich and creamy coffee blended with butter and MCT oil to keep you fueled.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon MCT oil or coconut oil
Optional: Pinch of cinnamon or vanilla extract
instructions: Brew your coffee as usual.
Carefully pour the hot coffee into a blender.
Add butter, MCT oil (or coconut oil), and any optional sweetener or flavorings.
Blend on high for 20-30 seconds until frothy and emulsified. Be cautious when blending hot liquids.
Pour into a mug and enjoy immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 021 - Coffee (Bulletproof Style) - Drinks

recipes.name: Berry Smoothie
recipes.description: A refreshing and low-carb berry smoothie perfect for a quick breakfast or snack.
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries - frozen is best)
1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1/4 cup heavy cream (optional, for extra creaminess)
1 tablespoon MCT oil or a scoop of keto-friendly protein powder (optional)
Handful of spinach (optional, for extra nutrients - you won't taste it much)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
If the smoothie is too thick, add a little more almond milk or water until desired consistency is reached.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 022 - Berry Smoothie - Drinks

recipes.name: Iced Tea (Unsweetened or Sweetened)
recipes.description: A refreshing keto iced tea, perfect for a hot day.
ingredients: 4-6 black or green tea bags (or loose leaf equivalent)
Optional: Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol)
Optional: Lemon slices or mint sprigs for garnish
instructions: Place tea bags in a large heatproof pitcher or pot.
Pour boiling water over the tea bags. Let steep for 5-10 minutes (or according to tea instructions).
Remove tea bags (or strain loose leaf tea).
If using sweetener, stir it in now while the tea is hot to help it dissolve.
Add cold water to the pitcher. Stir well.
Refrigerate until chilled, or serve immediately over ice.
Garnish with lemon slices or mint sprigs if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 023 - Iced Tea - Drinks

recipes.name: Hot Chocolate
recipes.description: A rich and creamy keto hot chocolate to warm you up.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol, monk fruit), to taste
1 tablespoon heavy cream (optional, for extra richness)
instructions: In a small saucepan, whisk together almond/coconut milk, cocoa powder, and sweetener.
Heat over medium-low heat, whisking frequently, until hot and the cocoa is fully dissolved. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. Stir in heavy cream (if using), vanilla extract, and salt.
Pour into a mug and serve immediately.
Optional: Top with keto-friendly whipped cream or a sprinkle of cocoa powder.
recipes.notes: Recipe 024 - Hot Chocolate - Drinks

recipes.name: Spicy Roasted Almonds
recipes.description: A crunchy and flavorful snack with a spicy kick, perfect for on-the-go.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a bowl, toss almonds with olive oil to coat evenly.
In a small bowl, mix smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
Sprinkle the spice mixture over the almonds and toss again to ensure they are well coated.
Spread the almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast for 12-15 minutes, stirring halfway through, until fragrant and lightly toasted. Be careful not to burn them.
Let cool completely on the baking sheet before storing. They will crisp up as they cool.
recipes.notes: Recipe 025 - Spicy Roasted Almonds - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Caprese Skewers
recipes.description: Simple, fresh, and elegant appetizer skewers with cherry tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
ingredients: 8 oz fresh mozzarella balls (pearls or ciliegine), drained
1 tablespoon balsamic glaze (ensure low carb or make keto version)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Thread a cherry tomato, a basil leaf (folded if large), and a mozzarella ball onto each skewer. Repeat if skewers are long enough for a second set.
Arrange the skewers on a serving platter.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season lightly with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.
recipes.notes: Recipe 026 - Caprese Skewers - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Bacon Wrapped Jalapeño Poppers
recipes.description: Spicy jalapeños stuffed with cream cheese and wrapped in crispy bacon.
ingredients: 10 fresh jalapeño peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
10 slices bacon, cut in half (20 half-slices)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a wire rack.
Wear gloves when handling jalapeños to avoid skin irritation.
In a medium bowl, combine softened cream cheese, shredded cheddar cheese, and garlic powder. Mix well.
Fill each jalapeño half with the cream cheese mixture.
Wrap each stuffed jalapeño half with a half-slice of bacon. Secure with a toothpick if needed.
Place the bacon-wrapped jalapeños on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the jalapeños are tender.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving as they will be very hot.
recipes.notes: Recipe 027 - Bacon Wrapped Jalapeño Poppers - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Avocado Egg Salad
recipes.description: A creamy and healthy egg salad using avocado instead of traditional mayo.
ingredients: 6 large hard-boiled eggs, peeled and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Chopped fresh dill or chives for garnish
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the chopped hard-boiled eggs and mashed avocado.
Add the chopped red onion, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice. Stir gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
Garnish with fresh dill or chives if desired.
Serve immediately on keto crackers, lettuce wraps, or as is.
recipes.notes: Recipe 028 - Avocado Egg Salad - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Spinach and Feta Omelette
recipes.description: A classic, flavorful omelette packed with spinach and salty feta cheese.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1 tablespoon heavy cream for fluffier eggs
instructions: In a bowl, whisk the eggs with salt, pepper, and heavy cream (if using) until well combined and slightly frothy.
Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add spinach to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes until wilted. Remove spinach and set aside, draining any excess liquid.
Pour the egg mixture into the hot skillet. Cook without stirring for 1-2 minutes, or until the edges begin to set.
Gently lift the cooked edges with a spatula and tilt the pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Once the omelette is mostly set but still slightly wet on top, sprinkle the cooked spinach and crumbled feta cheese over one half.
Fold the other half of the omelette over the filling.
Cook for another 1-2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the omelette is cooked through.
Slide onto a plate and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 029 - Spinach and Feta Omelette - Breakfast

recipes.name: Coconut Flour Waffles
recipes.description: Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, these coconut flour waffles are a keto treat.
ingredients: 1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
2 tablespoons melted butter or coconut oil
instructions: Preheat your waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.
In a medium bowl, whisk together sifted coconut flour, baking powder, salt, and sweetener.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, almond/coconut milk, melted butter/oil, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. The batter will be thicker than traditional waffle batter.
Let the batter sit for 5 minutes to allow the coconut flour to absorb the liquid.
Grease the waffle iron if necessary. Pour appropriate amount of batter onto the hot waffle iron (this will vary by machine).
Cook according to your waffle iron's instructions, usually 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Carefully remove the waffle and serve warm with keto-friendly toppings like butter, sugar-free syrup, or berries.
recipes.notes: Recipe 030 - Coconut Flour Waffles - Breakfast

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Pinwheels
recipes.description: Elegant and easy no-cook breakfast or brunch option with smoked salmon and herbed cream cheese.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill (or 1 teaspoon dried)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Capers, thinly sliced red onion
instructions: In a small bowl, combine softened cream cheese, dill, chives, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Lay out a large piece of plastic wrap on a clean surface.
Arrange the smoked salmon slices on the plastic wrap, slightly overlapping them to form a rectangle.
Carefully spread the herbed cream cheese mixture evenly over the smoked salmon.
If using, sprinkle capers or red onion over the cream cheese.
Starting from one of the shorter ends, tightly roll up the salmon and cream cheese into a log, using the plastic wrap to help guide and tighten the roll.
Wrap the log tightly in the plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (or up to a few hours) to firm up.
Unwrap the log and use a sharp knife to slice it into 1/2-inch to 1-inch thick pinwheels.
Arrange on a platter and serve.
recipes.notes: Recipe 031 - Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Pinwheels - Breakfast

recipes.name: Breakfast Burrito Bowl (No Tortilla)
recipes.description: All the flavors of a breakfast burrito in a hearty, low-carb bowl.
ingredients: 1/2 lb ground breakfast sausage or chorizo (check for no added sugar)
1/4 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese
Optional: Sour cream, chopped cilantro, jalapeños
instructions: In a skillet, cook the ground sausage or chorizo over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Drain any excess grease.
Prepare eggs to your liking (scrambled or fried).
Assemble the bowls: Divide the cooked sausage among two bowls.
Top with the cooked eggs, diced avocado, shredded cheese, and salsa.
Add optional toppings like a dollop of sour cream, chopped cilantro, or sliced jalapeños.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 032 - Breakfast Burrito Bowl (No Tortilla) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Creamy Tomato Soup
recipes.description: A rich and satisfying creamy tomato soup, perfect with keto grilled cheese.
ingredients: 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes (no sugar added)
1 teaspoon dried basil (or 1 tablespoon fresh, chopped)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Keto-friendly sweetener to balance acidity (e.g., a pinch of erythritol)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, vegetable or chicken broth, and dried basil. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Alternatively, carefully transfer the soup in batches to a regular blender and blend until smooth, then return to the pot.
Stir in the heavy cream. Heat through gently, but do not boil.
Season with salt, pepper, and sweetener (if using) to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 033 - Creamy Tomato Soup - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Cucumber Dill Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing and light cucumber salad with a creamy dill dressing.
ingredients: 1/2 cup sour cream or full-fat Greek yogurt
1 tablespoon white vinegar or apple cider vinegar
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Place sliced cucumbers and red onion (if using) in a colander. Sprinkle lightly with salt and let sit for 20-30 minutes to draw out excess water. Pat dry with paper towels.
In a medium bowl, combine sour cream (or Greek yogurt), chopped dill, vinegar, and sweetener (if using). Stir well.
Add the drained cucumbers and onions to the dressing. Toss gently to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 15-30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Best served chilled.
recipes.notes: Recipe 034 - Cucumber Dill Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Chicken Zoodle Soup
recipes.description: A comforting and low-carb version of classic chicken noodle soup using zucchini noodles.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 carrots, peeled and sliced (use sparingly for keto)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper, then add to the pot and cook until browned on all sides. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add onion, carrots, and celery to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Add minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Return the cooked chicken to the pot. Add chicken broth, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Remove the bay leaf. Stir in the zucchini noodles (zoodles). Cook for just 2-3 minutes until zoodles are slightly tender but not mushy.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Ladle into bowls and serve hot.
recipes.notes: Recipe 035 - Chicken Zoodle Soup - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Antipasto Salad
recipes.description: A hearty Italian-inspired salad packed with cured meats, cheeses, and olives.
ingredients: 4 oz salami, thinly sliced or cubed
4 oz provolone cheese, cubed or sliced
1/2 cup marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1/2 cup black or green olives, sliced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the dressing: In a small bowl or jar, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In a large salad bowl, combine mixed greens, salami, pepperoni, provolone cheese, artichoke hearts, olives, and pepperoncini (if using).
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat everything evenly.
Serve immediately, or chill for a short period before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 036 - Antipasto Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Cod with Green Beans
recipes.description: A quick and flavorful one-pan meal featuring tender cod and crisp green beans.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs cod fillets (or other white fish), cut into 4 portions
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, toss green beans with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them in a single layer on one side of the baking sheet.
Pat the cod fillets dry. Place them on the other side of the baking sheet.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil, minced garlic, Italian herbs, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Brush or pour the herb mixture evenly over the cod fillets. Top each fillet with a lemon slice.
Bake for 12-18 minutes, depending on the thickness of the cod, until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork, and the green beans are tender-crisp.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 037 - Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Cod with Green Beans - Main Course

recipes.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Beef
recipes.description: Colorful bell peppers filled with a savory ground beef and cauliflower rice mixture, topped with cheese.
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), halved lengthwise and seeded
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 cup shredded cheddar or mozzarella cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a baking dish.
Par-boil or microwave the bell pepper halves for 3-5 minutes until slightly tender. Drain and set aside in the baking dish.
In a large skillet, cook ground beef and chopped onion over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is softened. Drain any excess fat.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Stir in cauliflower rice, tomato sauce, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until cauliflower rice is tender and flavors are combined.
Spoon the beef mixture evenly into the bell pepper halves.
Top each stuffed pepper with shredded cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let cool slightly before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 038 - Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Beef - Main Course

recipes.name: Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce
recipes.description: Juicy pork chops smothered in a rich and creamy mushroom sauce.
ingredients: 4 boneless or bone-in pork chops (about 1-inch thick)
8 oz cremini or button mushrooms, sliced
1 small shallot or 1/4 onion, finely chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Pat pork chops dry and season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature of 145°F or 63°C). Remove from skillet and set aside, keep warm.
To the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Add sliced mushrooms and shallot (or onion). Cook, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are browned and softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes to reduce slightly.
Stir in heavy cream and Dijon mustard. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Return the pork chops to the skillet, spooning some sauce over them. Heat through for a minute.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 039 - Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce - Main Course

recipes.name: Cauliflower Crust Pizza
recipes.description: A popular low-carb alternative to traditional pizza, with a crispy cauliflower crust.
ingredients: 1 medium head of cauliflower (about 4 cups riced)
1 teaspoon dried oregano or Italian seasoning
1/4 cup keto-friendly tomato sauce (no sugar added)
Your favorite keto toppings (pepperoni, cooked sausage, mushrooms, olives, bell peppers etc.)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a pizza stone.
Rice the cauliflower: Cut cauliflower into florets and pulse in a food processor until it resembles rice. Or use pre-riced cauliflower.
Cook the cauliflower rice: Steam or microwave until tender (about 5-8 minutes).
VERY IMPORTANT: Let the cooked cauliflower cool slightly, then transfer it to a clean kitchen towel or cheesecloth. Squeeze out as much liquid as possible. This is key to a crispy crust.
In a large bowl, combine the squeezed cauliflower rice, beaten egg, 1/2 cup mozzarella, Parmesan cheese, oregano/Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well until a 'dough' forms.
Transfer the cauliflower mixture to the prepared baking sheet. Spread and press it into a 10-12 inch round pizza crust shape, about 1/4 inch thick.
Bake the crust for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and firm.
Remove the crust from the oven. Spread with tomato sauce, then top with the remaining 1 cup of mozzarella cheese and your desired keto toppings.
Return the pizza to the oven and bake for another 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the toppings are heated through.
Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 040 - Cauliflower Crust Pizza - Main Course

recipes.name: No-Bake Chocolate Peanut Butter Bars
recipes.description: Rich and decadent no-bake bars with layers of peanut butter and chocolate.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter or coconut oil
instructions: Line an 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on two sides for easy removal.
Prepare the peanut butter layer: In a medium bowl, combine peanut butter, softened butter, powdered sweetener, almond flour, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined and smooth.
Press the peanut butter mixture evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Prepare the chocolate topping: In a microwave-safe bowl or a small saucepan over low heat, melt the sugar-free chocolate chips with the butter or coconut oil. Stir until smooth.
Pour the melted chocolate mixture evenly over the peanut butter layer.
Refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours, or until the bars are firm and the chocolate is set.
Once firm, use the parchment paper overhang to lift the bars out of the pan. Cut into squares.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
recipes.notes: Recipe 041 - No-Bake Chocolate Peanut Butter Bars - Desserts

recipes.name: Strawberry Coconut Cream Popsicles
recipes.description: Refreshing and creamy sugar-free popsicles made with strawberries and coconut milk.
ingredients: 1 (13.5 oz) can full-fat coconut milk, well shaken
2-4 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., liquid stevia or powdered erythritol), to taste
instructions: If using frozen strawberries, let them thaw slightly.
Combine strawberries, coconut milk, sweetener, and vanilla extract (if using) in a blender.
Blend until completely smooth. Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Pour the mixture evenly into popsicle molds.
Insert popsicle sticks.
Freeze for at least 4-6 hours, or until solid.
To release popsicles, run the molds under warm water for a few seconds.
recipes.notes: Recipe 042 - Strawberry Coconut Cream Popsicles - Desserts

recipes.name: Almond Flour Shortbread Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery and tender shortbread cookies made with almond flour.
ingredients: 2 cups blanched almond flour, finely ground
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, cream together softened butter and powdered sweetener with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Beat in vanilla extract and salt.
Gradually add the almond flour, mixing on low speed until just combined and a dough forms. Do not overmix.
Roll the dough between two pieces of parchment paper to about 1/4-inch thickness.
Use cookie cutters to cut out shapes, or cut the dough into squares or rectangles with a knife or pizza cutter.
Carefully transfer the cookies to the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden. They will be soft when removed from the oven but will firm up as they cool.
Let cool on the baking sheet for 5-10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
recipes.notes: Recipe 043 - Almond Flour Shortbread Cookies - Desserts

recipes.name: Raspberry Chia Jam
recipes.description: A quick and easy sugar-free raspberry jam thickened with chia seeds.
ingredients: 2-4 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol or monk fruit), to taste
instructions: If using frozen raspberries, you can use them directly or let them thaw slightly.
Combine raspberries and sweetener in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-10 minutes, until the raspberries break down and the mixture becomes juicy.
Mash the raspberries with a fork or potato masher to your desired consistency.
Stir in the chia seeds and lemon juice (if using).
Reduce heat to low and simmer for another 5 minutes, stirring frequently, as the jam thickens.
Remove from heat and let cool completely. The jam will continue to thicken as it cools.
Transfer to an airtight container or jar and store in the refrigerator. Use within 1-2 weeks.
recipes.notes: Recipe 044 - Raspberry Chia Jam - Desserts

recipes.name: Sparkling Lime and Mint Cooler
recipes.description: A refreshing and bubbly non-alcoholic drink, similar to a virgin mojito.
ingredients: Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or erythritol syrup)
1 cup sparkling water or club soda
Optional: Lime slices and mint sprigs for garnish
instructions: In a sturdy glass, add lime wedges and fresh mint leaves.
Add sweetener to taste.
Muddle gently to release the lime juice and mint oils. Do not over-muddle the mint or it can become bitter.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Top with sparkling water or club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with additional lime slices and a mint sprig if desired. Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 045 - Sparkling Lime and Mint Cooler - Drinks

recipes.name: Turmeric Latte (Golden Milk)
recipes.description: A warm, comforting, and anti-inflammatory drink made with turmeric and spices.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
Pinch of black pepper (helps with turmeric absorption)
1 teaspoon coconut oil or MCT oil (optional)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., stevia or erythritol)
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine almond/coconut milk, ground turmeric, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, and black pepper.
Whisk well to combine.
Heat over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until warm. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. Stir in coconut oil/MCT oil (if using) and sweetener to taste.
Pour into a mug. For a frothier latte, you can use a milk frother or carefully blend in a blender (vent if hot).
Serve warm.
recipes.notes: Recipe 046 - Turmeric Latte (Golden Milk) - Drinks

recipes.name: Electrolyte Drink (Homemade)
recipes.description: A simple homemade electrolyte drink to help replenish minerals on a keto diet.
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh lemon or lime juice
1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon pink Himalayan salt or sea salt
1/8 teaspoon potassium chloride powder (e.g., NoSalt or Lite Salt) - optional
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol)
Optional: A few drops of magnesium citrate liquid or a small pinch of food-grade magnesium powder
instructions: In a glass or bottle, combine water and lemon/lime juice.
Add salt, potassium chloride (if using), and magnesium (if using).
Add sweetener to taste.
Stir or shake well until all ingredients are dissolved.
Serve chilled or over ice. Adjust ingredients based on your taste and electrolyte needs.
recipes.notes: Recipe 047 - Electrolyte Drink (Homemade) - Drinks

recipes.name: Chocolate Fat Bomb Smoothie
recipes.description: A rich and creamy smoothie packed with healthy fats and chocolate flavor.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1 tablespoon almond butter or peanut butter (unsweetened)
1 tablespoon MCT oil or coconut oil
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol)
Optional: 1 scoop keto-friendly chocolate protein powder
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender: almond/coconut milk, avocado, cocoa powder, almond/peanut butter, MCT/coconut oil, sweetener, ice cubes, and protein powder (if using).
Blend until smooth and creamy. Scrape down sides if necessary.
Taste and adjust sweetener or cocoa powder if needed.
Pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 048 - Chocolate Fat Bomb Smoothie - Drinks

recipes.name: Creamy Vanilla Bean Custard
recipes.description: A classic, smooth, and rich baked custard infused with real vanilla bean.
ingredients: 1/2 vanilla bean, split and scraped (or 1.5 teaspoons vanilla extract)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C). Have 4-6 (6-oz) ramekins ready and a baking dish large enough to hold them without touching.

In a small saucepan, combine heavy cream and the vanilla bean seeds and pod (if using vanilla extract, add it later). Heat over medium-low heat until it just begins to simmer around the edges. Do not boil. Remove from heat and let steep for 15-20 minutes if using vanilla bean pod. Remove pod.
In a medium bowl, whisk together egg yolks, sweetener, and salt until pale and slightly thickened.
Slowly pour the warm cream into the egg yolk mixture in a thin stream, whisking constantly to temper the eggs and prevent scrambling.
If you used vanilla extract, stir it in now.
Strain the custard mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into another bowl or large measuring cup to remove any cooked egg bits.
Divide the custard mixture evenly among the ramekins.
Place the ramekins in the larger baking dish. Carefully pour hot water into the baking dish to come about halfway up the sides of the ramekins (water bath/bain-marie).
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the custards are just set around the edges but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Carefully remove the ramekins from the water bath and let cool on a wire rack. Then, refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours, or until completely chilled and firm.
Optional: Sprinkle with ground nutmeg before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 049 - Creamy Vanilla Bean Custard - Desserts

recipes.name: Herbed Cream Cheese Cucumber Bites
recipes.description: Cool and refreshing cucumber slices topped with savory herbed cream cheese.
ingredients: 1 large cucumber, sliced into 1/4-inch thick rounds
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional garnish: Paprika or everything bagel seasoning
instructions: Pat cucumber slices dry with a paper towel to help the cream cheese adhere.
In a small bowl, combine softened cream cheese, chives, parsley, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Spread or pipe a small amount of the herbed cream cheese mixture onto each cucumber slice.
Garnish with a sprinkle of paprika or everything bagel seasoning if desired.
Arrange on a platter and serve immediately, or chill for up to an hour.
recipes.notes: Recipe 050 - Herbed Cream Cheese Cucumber Bites - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Marinated Olives with Feta
recipes.description: A flavorful mix of olives and feta cheese marinated in herbs and olive oil.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed olives (Kalamata, Castelvetrano, etc.), pitted
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine mixed olives and cubed feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, sliced garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes (if using), and lemon zest.
Pour the marinade over the olives and feta. Toss gently to coat.
Cover and let marinate at room temperature for at least 30 minutes, or refrigerate for longer (bring to room temperature before serving if refrigerated).
Serve with toothpicks or as part of an antipasto platter.
recipes.notes: Recipe 051 - Marinated Olives with Feta - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Salami and Provolone Roll-Ups
recipes.description: Simple and satisfying roll-ups, perfect for a quick snack or party appetizer.
ingredients: Optional: 4 oz cream cheese, softened, mixed with Italian herbs
Optional: Thinly sliced pepperoncini or roasted red peppers
instructions: Lay a slice of salami flat.
Top with a slice of provolone cheese (trim to fit if necessary).
If using herbed cream cheese, spread a thin layer over the provolone.
If using pepperoncini or roasted red peppers, place a small amount at one end.
Tightly roll up the salami and cheese.
Secure with a toothpick if needed, or slice into bite-sized pinwheels.
Arrange on a platter and serve. Can be made ahead and chilled.
recipes.notes: Recipe 052 - Salami and Provolone Roll-Ups - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Baked Parmesan Zucchini Fries
recipes.description: Crispy and flavorful zucchini fries coated in Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 2 medium zucchinis, cut into fry-shaped sticks
1/4 cup almond flour (optional, for extra crispiness)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and optionally place a wire rack on top.
Pat the zucchini sticks dry with paper towels.
In a shallow dish or plate, combine grated Parmesan cheese, almond flour (if using), garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In another shallow dish, place the beaten egg.
Dip each zucchini stick into the beaten egg, allowing any excess to drip off.
Then, dredge the zucchini stick in the Parmesan mixture, pressing gently to adhere.
Place the coated zucchini sticks in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet or wire rack.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
Serve immediately with your favorite keto-friendly dipping sauce (e.g., marinara, ranch).
recipes.notes: Recipe 053 - Baked Parmesan Zucchini Fries - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Denver Scramble (Crustless)
recipes.description: A hearty scramble with all the classic Denver omelette fillings.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add diced ham, chopped green bell pepper, and chopped onion to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and ham is lightly browned.
Pour the lightly beaten eggs over the ham and vegetable mixture.
Cook, stirring gently and scraping the bottom of the skillet, until eggs are cooked to your desired consistency.
Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese during the last minute of cooking, allowing it to melt.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 054 - Denver Scramble (Crustless) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Flaxseed Porridge
recipes.description: A warm and comforting low-carb porridge made with ground flaxseed.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol, stevia), to taste
Optional toppings: Berries, chopped nuts, chia seeds, a pat of butter
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine ground flaxseed meal and almond/coconut milk. Whisk well to prevent clumps.
Heat over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, for 3-5 minutes, or until the porridge thickens to your desired consistency.
Remove from heat. Stir in sweetener, vanilla extract, and cinnamon (if using).
Pour into a bowl and add your favorite keto-friendly toppings.
Serve warm.
recipes.notes: Recipe 055 - Flaxseed Porridge - Breakfast

recipes.name: Steak and Eggs
recipes.description: A classic, protein-packed breakfast of tender steak and perfectly cooked eggs.
ingredients: 6-8 oz steak (e.g., sirloin, ribeye, or leftover cooked steak)
1 tablespoon butter or avocado oil, divided
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional garnish: Chopped parsley or chives
instructions: Season steak with salt and pepper. If using raw steak, cook it to your desired doneness: Heat 1/2 tablespoon of butter/oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear steak for 3-5 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer for more well-done. Let rest for a few minutes, then slice if desired.
If using leftover steak, warm it gently in the skillet.
In the same or a separate skillet, heat the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of butter/oil over medium heat.
Crack eggs into the skillet. Cook to your preference (fried, sunny-side up, over easy, etc.). Season with salt and pepper.
Serve the steak alongside the cooked eggs.
Garnish with parsley or chives if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 056 - Steak and Eggs - Breakfast

recipes.name: Cottage Cheese with Berries and Nuts
recipes.description: A quick and easy high-protein breakfast or snack.
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries - use sparingly)
Optional: Sprinkle of cinnamon or chia seeds
instructions: Spoon cottage cheese into a bowl.
Top with mixed berries and chopped nuts.
If desired, drizzle with sweetener or sprinkle with cinnamon or chia seeds.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 057 - Cottage Cheese with Berries and Nuts - Breakfast

recipes.name: Cream of Mushroom Soup
recipes.description: A rich and earthy cream of mushroom soup, far better than canned.
ingredients: 1 lb cremini or button mushrooms, sliced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1 tablespoon sherry or white wine for deglazing (check carbs)
instructions: Melt butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add sliced mushrooms and chopped onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are browned and onions are softened, about 8-10 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
If using sherry/wine, pour it in and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Let it simmer for a minute.
Add chicken or vegetable broth and thyme. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to partially or fully blend the soup to your desired consistency. For a chunkier soup, remove about a cup of mushrooms before blending and add them back in.
Stir in heavy cream. Heat through gently, but do not boil.
Season generously with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh thyme or parsley if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 058 - Cream of Mushroom Soup - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: BLT Salad with Avocado Ranch
recipes.description: All the classic BLT flavors in a satisfying salad with creamy avocado ranch dressing.
ingredients: 6 slices bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled
1 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, halved
1-2 tablespoons water or unsweetened almond milk, to thin
instructions: Prepare the Avocado Ranch Dressing: In a small bowl, combine mashed avocado, mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, dill, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Whisk until smooth. Add water or almond milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached. Set aside.
In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, halved tomatoes, and diced avocado.
Add the crumbled crispy bacon to the salad.
Drizzle with the Avocado Ranch Dressing and toss gently to coat.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 059 - BLT Salad with Avocado Ranch - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Spinach Salad with Hot Bacon Dressing
recipes.description: A classic spinach salad with a warm, tangy bacon dressing and hard-boiled eggs.
ingredients: 5-6 oz fresh spinach, washed and dried
2 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and sliced or quartered
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the chopped bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside on a paper towel-lined plate, reserving about 2-3 tablespoons of bacon grease in the skillet.
In a large salad bowl, place the fresh spinach, sliced hard-boiled eggs, and red onion (if using).

Prepare the Hot Bacon Dressing: Reheat the reserved bacon grease in the skillet over low heat if necessary. Whisk in red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, and sweetener (if using). Season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 1 minute, whisking, until warmed through.
Pour the hot dressing immediately over the spinach salad. Add the crispy bacon crumbles.
Toss gently to coat the spinach with the warm dressing.
Serve immediately while the dressing is still warm.
recipes.notes: Recipe 060 - Spinach Salad with Hot Bacon Dressing - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Thai Peanut Zoodle Salad
recipes.description: A vibrant and flavorful salad with zucchini noodles and a creamy Thai peanut dressing.
ingredients: 1 small red bell pepper, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons chopped peanuts or almonds (for garnish)
2 tablespoons soy sauce or coconut aminos
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia)
instructions: Prepare the Thai Peanut Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce/coconut aminos, lime juice, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, and sweetener. Gradually whisk in hot water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the dressing reaches a smooth, pourable consistency.
In a large bowl, combine zoodles, sliced red bell pepper, shredded carrots, and chopped cilantro.
Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients and toss gently to coat everything well.
Garnish with chopped peanuts or almonds before serving.
Can be served immediately or chilled for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
recipes.notes: Recipe 061 - Thai Peanut Zoodle Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo with Zucchini Noodles
recipes.description: Classic chicken Alfredo made keto-friendly with zucchini noodles.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it starts to thicken slightly.
Reduce heat to low and stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and the sauce is smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the zoodles to the skillet with the Alfredo sauce. Toss to coat and cook for 2-3 minutes, just until zoodles are slightly tender (do not overcook or they become watery).
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss to combine with the zoodles and sauce. Heat through.
Serve immediately, garnished with fresh parsley.
recipes.notes: Recipe 062 - Chicken Alfredo with Zucchini Noodles - Main Course

recipes.name: Shepherd's Pie with Cauliflower Topping
recipes.description: A comforting shepherd's pie with a savory meat filling and a creamy cauliflower mash topping.
ingredients: 1 large head cauliflower, cut into florets
1/4 cup heavy cream or sour cream
instructions: Prepare the Cauliflower Topping: Steam or boil cauliflower florets until very tender (about 10-15 minutes). Drain well.
Transfer cooked cauliflower to a food processor or use an immersion blender. Add butter, heavy cream/sour cream, Parmesan (if using), salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy. Set aside.
Prepare the Meat Filling: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add ground meat and cook, breaking it apart, until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in minced garlic, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and dried herbs. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
Pour in beef broth. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper.
Assemble and Bake: If your skillet is not oven-safe, transfer the meat filling to a baking dish.
Spoon the cauliflower topping evenly over the meat filling. You can use a fork to create a textured surface.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the topping is lightly golden and the filling is bubbly.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 063 - Shepherd's Pie with Cauliflower Topping - Main Course

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Shrimp Scampi with Zoodles
recipes.description: Classic shrimp scampi lightened up with zucchini noodles in a rich garlic butter sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/4 cup dry white wine or chicken broth
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Pat shrimp dry and season lightly with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes (if using). Cook for about 1 minute until fragrant (do not burn garlic).
Add shrimp to the skillet in a single layer. Cook for 1-2 minutes per side, until pink and opaque. Do not overcook.
Pour in white wine (or chicken broth) and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer and cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the sauce to reduce slightly.
Stir in chopped fresh parsley.
Add zoodles to the skillet and toss gently with the shrimp and sauce for 1-2 minutes, just until slightly tender.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 064 - Garlic Butter Shrimp Scampi with Zoodles - Main Course

recipes.name: Eggplant Parmesan (Low Carb)
recipes.description: A keto-friendly take on classic Eggplant Parmesan, with baked eggplant slices instead of breaded.
ingredients: 2 medium eggplants, sliced into 1/2-inch thick rounds
1.5 cups keto-friendly marinara sauce (no sugar added)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

Prepare Eggplant: Arrange eggplant slices on a baking sheet or wire rack. Sprinkle both sides lightly with salt and let sit for 20-30 minutes to draw out excess moisture and bitterness. Pat dry with paper towels.
Brush both sides of the eggplant slices with olive oil. Arrange in a single layer on one or two baking sheets.
Roast for 15-20 minutes, flipping once, until tender and lightly browned.
Assemble: Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C). In a 9x13 inch baking dish (or similar), spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom.
Arrange a layer of roasted eggplant slices over the sauce. Top with some marinara sauce, a sprinkle of mozzarella, and a sprinkle of Parmesan.
Repeat layers until all eggplant is used, finishing with a layer of sauce and a generous topping of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the cheese is melted and golden.
Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh basil.
recipes.notes: Recipe 065 - Eggplant Parmesan (Low Carb) - Main Course

recipes.name: Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta
recipes.description: An elegant and creamy Italian dessert, made keto-friendly.
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk or full-fat coconut milk
1 vanilla bean, split and scraped (or 1.5 teaspoons vanilla extract)
Optional: Berry coulis for serving (made with keto sweetener)
instructions: In a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin powder over cold water. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes to bloom (soften).
In a medium saucepan, combine heavy cream, almond/coconut milk, sweetener, and the vanilla bean seeds and pod (if using extract, add later).
Heat over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is hot and the sweetener has dissolved. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. If using a vanilla bean pod, remove it now.
Add the bloomed gelatin mixture to the warm cream. Whisk until the gelatin is completely dissolved.
If using vanilla extract, stir it in now.
Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl or pitcher.
Divide the panna cotta mixture evenly among 4-6 small ramekins or serving glasses.
Refrigerate for at least 4-6 hours, or until fully set.
To serve, you can unmold onto a plate (dip ramekin briefly in hot water) or serve directly in the glasses. Top with keto berry coulis if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 066 - Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta - Desserts

recipes.name: Coconut Macaroons
recipes.description: Chewy and delicious sugar-free coconut macaroons.
ingredients: Optional: Sugar-free chocolate drizzle (melted Lily's chips)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine unsweetened shredded coconut and powdered sweetener. Mix well.
In a separate clean bowl, beat egg whites with vanilla extract and salt until soft peaks form (not stiff).
Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the coconut mixture until just combined. Do not overmix.
Drop rounded tablespoons of the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, about 1-2 inches apart. You can shape them slightly with your fingers or a small cookie scoop.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the macaroons are set.
Let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
If desired, drizzle with melted sugar-free chocolate once cooled.
recipes.notes: Recipe 067 - Coconut Macaroons - Desserts

recipes.name: Lemon Blueberry Scones
recipes.description: Tender and flavorful scones with bright lemon and juicy blueberries.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cold unsalted butter, cut into small cubes
1/2 cup fresh or frozen blueberries (if frozen, do not thaw)
Optional Glaze: Powdered erythritol mixed with a little lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together almond flour, sweetener, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in the cold butter using a pastry blender or your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
In a small bowl, whisk together beaten egg, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and lemon zest.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
Gently fold in the blueberries.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface (use a little almond flour). Pat into a 3/4-inch thick round or rectangle.
Cut into 8 wedges (if round) or squares/rectangles. Place scones on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
If desired, drizzle with lemon glaze once cooled.
recipes.notes: Recipe 068 - Lemon Blueberry Scones - Desserts

recipes.name: Avocado Chocolate Pudding
recipes.description: A surprisingly rich and creamy chocolate pudding made with avocado.
ingredients: 1/3 cup keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol or monk fruit), or to taste
1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk (plus more if needed)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender: avocados, cocoa powder, sweetener, almond/coconut milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until completely smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed.
If the pudding is too thick, add a little more almond/coconut milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached.
Taste and adjust sweetener if necessary.
Divide into serving dishes and chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Garnish with berries, whipped cream, or sugar-free chocolate shavings if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 069 - Avocado Chocolate Pudding - Desserts

recipes.name: Matcha Green Tea Latte
recipes.description: A creamy and energizing latte made with matcha green tea powder.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon matcha green tea powder (culinary or ceremonial grade)
1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk, heated
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol)
Optional: 1/2 teaspoon coconut oil or MCT oil for creaminess
instructions: In a mug or bowl, sift the matcha powder to prevent clumps.

Add the 2 tablespoons of hot water to the matcha powder. Whisk vigorously in a zigzag motion with a bamboo matcha whisk (chasen) or a small regular whisk/milk frother until frothy and no lumps remain.
Heat the almond/coconut milk until warm (do not boil).
Add sweetener and coconut/MCT oil (if using) to the warm milk and stir or froth.
Pour the frothed/warmed milk over the matcha mixture in the mug.
Stir gently and enjoy immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 070 - Matcha Green Tea Latte - Drinks

recipes.name: Cucumber Mint Infused Water
recipes.description: A simple and refreshing infused water to stay hydrated.
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, lightly bruised
Optional: Slices of lemon or lime
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine sliced cucumber and mint leaves.
Add lemon or lime slices if desired.
Pour cold filtered water over the ingredients.
Stir gently.
Refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours to allow flavors to infuse. For best flavor, infuse for 4 hours or overnight.
Serve chilled over ice.
recipes.notes: Recipe 071 - Cucumber Mint Infused Water - Drinks

recipes.name: Spiced Chai Tea (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A warming and aromatic sugar-free version of classic chai tea.
ingredients: 2 black tea bags (or 2 teaspoons loose leaf black tea)
1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
2-3 green cardamom pods, lightly crushed (or 1/4 tsp ground cardamom)
2-3 whole cloves (or pinch of ground cloves)
1/4 inch fresh ginger, sliced (or 1/4 tsp ground ginger)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., stevia, erythritol)
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine water and all chai spices (cinnamon stick, cardamom, cloves, ginger, peppercorns). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5-10 minutes to infuse flavors.
Add the black tea bags (or loose tea) to the spiced water. Steep for 3-5 minutes according to tea preference. Remove tea bags or strain loose tea.
Stir in the unsweetened almond/coconut milk and heat gently until warm. Do not boil.
Strain the chai tea into a mug to remove whole spices if used.
Add keto-friendly sweetener to taste.
Serve warm. For a latte feel, you can froth the milk before adding.
recipes.notes: Recipe 072 - Spiced Chai Tea (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate
recipes.description: A smooth, low-acid coffee concentrate perfect for iced coffee or mixing.
instructions: In a large jar or container, combine coarsely ground coffee and cold filtered water. Stir gently to ensure all grounds are saturated.
Cover the container and let it steep at room temperature for 12-18 hours, or in the refrigerator for 18-24 hours.
After steeping, strain the coffee concentrate. Line a fine-mesh sieve with cheesecloth or a coffee filter (paper or reusable cloth) and place it over another clean jar or pitcher.
Slowly pour the coffee mixture through the filter. This may take some time. Avoid squeezing the grounds too much to prevent bitterness.
Once strained, you'll have a coffee concentrate. Store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1-2 weeks.

To serve: Mix the concentrate with water, unsweetened almond/coconut milk, or heavy cream to your desired strength (e.g., 1 part concentrate to 1-2 parts liquid). Serve over ice, with keto sweetener if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 073 - Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate - Drinks

recipes.name: Simple Bone Broth Sipper
recipes.description: A nourishing and savory warm drink, great for gut health and electrolytes.
ingredients: 1 cup high-quality bone broth (chicken, beef, or turkey - check for no added sugar/MSG)
Pinch of sea salt or pink Himalayan salt
Optional additions: 1/2 teaspoon grated fresh ginger, 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder, a squeeze of lemon juice, a sprig of fresh herbs (thyme, rosemary)
instructions: Pour bone broth into a small saucepan or microwave-safe mug.
Heat gently on the stovetop or in the microwave until warm to hot, but not boiling.
Stir in salt, pepper, and any optional additions you like.
Sip slowly and enjoy. Especially good on a cold day or when you need a savory pick-me-up.
recipes.notes: Recipe 074 - Simple Bone Broth Sipper - Drinks

recipes.name: Ants on a Log (Keto Style)
recipes.description: A classic kid-friendly snack made keto with celery, nut butter, and a few low-carb 'ants'.
ingredients: 3-4 celery stalks, washed and cut into 3-4 inch pieces
1/4 cup unsweetened almond butter or sunflower seed butter
1 tablespoon sugar-free chocolate chips or a few raisins (use raisins very sparingly for strict keto)
instructions: Spread the almond butter or sunflower seed butter into the groove of each celery stick.
Arrange the sugar-free chocolate chips or raisins on top of the nut butter, resembling ants on a log.
Serve immediately. A fun and easy snack for kids!
recipes.notes: Recipe 075 - Ants on a Log (Keto Style) - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Mini Pepper Nachos
recipes.description: Colorful mini bell peppers topped with seasoned ground beef and cheese, a fun nacho alternative.
ingredients: 1 lb mini sweet peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
1/2 packet taco seasoning (check for low sugar/fillers)
1 cup shredded cheddar or Mexican blend cheese
Optional toppings: Sour cream, guacamole, chopped cilantro, keto-friendly salsa
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Arrange pepper halves cut-side up on a baking sheet.
In a skillet, brown the ground beef or turkey over medium heat. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in taco seasoning and water. Simmer for 3-5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Spoon the seasoned meat mixture into each mini pepper half.
Sprinkle generously with shredded cheese.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until peppers are tender-crisp and cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve warm with desired toppings. Kids love these!
recipes.notes: Recipe 076 - Mini Pepper Nachos - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Strawberry Cheesecake Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Creamy, bite-sized treats that taste like strawberry cheesecake.
ingredients: 1/4 cup powdered erythritol (or other keto powdered sweetener)
1/4 cup finely diced fresh strawberries (or 2 tbsp sugar-free strawberry jam)
Optional: 1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut for rolling
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat together softened cream cheese, softened butter, powdered erythritol, and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy.
Gently fold in the finely diced strawberries or sugar-free strawberry jam.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for about 20-30 minutes to firm up slightly, making it easier to roll.
Roll the mixture into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter).
If desired, roll the fat bombs in shredded coconut.
Place on a parchment-lined plate and freeze for at least 30 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 077 - Strawberry Cheesecake Fat Bombs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Ham and Cheese Pickle Roll-Ups
recipes.description: A quick, crunchy, and savory snack that's a hit with all ages.
ingredients: Optional: Everything bagel seasoning or a pinch of garlic powder
instructions: Lay out the ham slices on a clean surface.
If using, mix cream cheese with everything bagel seasoning or garlic powder.
Spread a thin layer of cream cheese evenly over each ham slice.
Place a dill pickle at one end of each ham slice.
Tightly roll up the ham around the pickle.
You can serve the roll-ups whole or slice them into bite-sized pinwheels (about 1/2 to 1 inch thick).
Secure with toothpicks if slicing into pinwheels. Chill for a few minutes if they are too soft to slice easily.
recipes.notes: Recipe 078 - Ham and Cheese Pickle Roll-Ups - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Pancake Bites (Muffins)
recipes.description: Fluffy mini pancake muffins, perfect for a quick kid-friendly breakfast or snack.
ingredients: Optional: Sugar-free chocolate chips or blueberries (use sparingly)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a mini muffin tin or line with mini paper liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk together almond flour, sweetener, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, almond milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
If using, gently fold in sugar-free chocolate chips or blueberries.
Spoon the batter evenly into the prepared mini muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature. Great for dipping in keto syrup!
recipes.notes: Recipe 079 - Pancake Bites (Muffins) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Green Smoothie (Kid-Friendly)
recipes.description: A mildly sweet and nutrient-packed green smoothie that even kids might enjoy.
ingredients: 1 cup fresh spinach (mild flavor, won't taste it much)
1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1/4 cup full-fat Greek yogurt or 1/4 avocado for creaminess
1/4 cup mixed berries (strawberries or blueberries work well)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or monk fruit)
Optional: 1 tablespoon chia seeds or a scoop of vanilla keto protein powder
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender: spinach, almond/coconut milk, Greek yogurt/avocado, berries, and sweetener.
Add chia seeds or protein powder if using.
Blend until completely smooth and creamy. Add a little more milk if it's too thick.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately. Using a fun straw can help with kids!
recipes.notes: Recipe 080 - Green Smoothie (Kid-Friendly) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Sausage Patties with Fried Eggs
recipes.description: A simple, classic, and satisfying breakfast favorite.
ingredients: 1 lb ground pork sausage (check for no added sugar)
1/2 teaspoon dried sage (optional, if sausage isn't seasoned enough)
Salt and black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon butter or bacon grease for frying eggs
instructions: If your sausage is unseasoned, mix it with sage, salt, and pepper.
Form the ground sausage into 4-6 patties, about 1/2-inch thick.
Cook sausage patties in a large skillet over medium heat for 4-6 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through (internal temperature of 160°F or 71°C). Remove from skillet and keep warm.
In the same skillet (you can use some of the sausage grease or add butter), fry the eggs to your liking (sunny-side up, over easy, etc.). Season with salt and pepper.
Serve the sausage patties alongside the fried eggs.
recipes.notes: Recipe 081 - Sausage Patties with Fried Eggs - Breakfast

recipes.name: French Toast Chaffles
recipes.description: A quick and easy way to enjoy the taste of French toast, keto style!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon heavy cream or unsweetened almond milk
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., 1-2 tsp erythritol)
1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (for chaffle structure)
instructions: Preheat your mini waffle maker (chaffle maker).
In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, almond flour, heavy cream/almond milk, cinnamon, vanilla extract, nutmeg (if using), and sweetener.
Stir in the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Grease the waffle maker if necessary. Pour half of the batter into the preheated waffle maker.
Cook for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Carefully remove the chaffle and repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve warm with butter and keto-friendly syrup. Kids love these with berries.
recipes.notes: Recipe 082 - French Toast Chaffles - Breakfast

recipes.name: Taco Soup (Easy Weeknight)
